intro: Euphrasia minima proles drosocalyx, commonly known as the small yellow evening-primrose, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in the late afternoon. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and soothing effects.
